def barplot(df,figsize=(12,8), palette=None):
    """
    Example: 
    df1 = df['c0'].value_counts().nlargest(10)
    """
    
    palettes = ['Accent','Accent_r', 'cool_r', 'CMRmap_r','Dark2','Dark2_r',
            'gist_heat','gist_heat_r','gist_stern','gist_stern_r',
            'icefire','icefire_r','inferno','inferno_r','magma',
            'magma_r','mako','mako_r','plasma','plasma_r','PuRd',
            'PuRd_r','rainbow','rainbow_r','RdPu','RdPu_r','RdYlGn',
            'RdYlGn_r','Reds','Reds_r','rocket','rocket_r','spring_r',
            'summer','twilight','twilight_r','viridis','viridis_r']


    if palette == None:
        palette = palettes[np.random.randint(len(palettes))]
        
    plt.figure(figsize=figsize)
    ax = sns.barplot(x=df1.index, y=df1.values, alpha=0.8,palette=palette)
    plt.ylabel('', fontsize=15)
    plt.xlabel('', fontsize=12,rotation=90)

    # total counts
    rects = ax.patches
    labels = df1.values
    for rect, label in zip(rects, labels):
        height = rect.get_height()
        ax.text(rect.get_x() + rect.get_width()/2, 
                height* 0.9, label, ha='center', va='bottom')
        
    loc, labels = plt.xticks()
    ax.set_xticklabels(labels, rotation=45)
    plt.show()
